reviewText: I consider myself at an intermediate level of fitness.Another good workout from this instructor.  I used free weights instead of barbell and medicine ball.Boot Camp:Cuing ok, moves are not complex so not a major factor one way or another.  Like the mix of moves and flow.  Good camera work with no bad focus or unnecessary zoom ins.  Music has good beat which instructor follows and I can follow when facing away from TV.  Too many "backup dancers" so looks rather crowded but they are quiet and non-annoying so ok.  Nice mix of strength and cardio.  I usually hate going up and down and up and down between cardio and floor work but it is not so bad when it is weights-cardio-floor.  While each segment is tough, just when I am feeling the I-cannot-do-one-more-rep-or-jack, you move on to the next segment so the mix works here.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow.  Her workouts are tough but I love them all and they get you working.  She is always no-nonsense and motivating and you need it to get through them.  It's a great feeling when you are done because you know you've worked hard and burned a lot of calories and fat.This workout is another great one from Cathe.  It's two separate workouts; the first being aerobics with toning intervals and the second being high-rep body sculpting routines.  The first workout (Boot Camp) is broken up into eight cycles each with four one-minute intervals that include floor aerobics, core workout, upper and lower body workouts.  It's tough at times but stick to it and it does get easier.  Then you do the second workout which is the muscle toning and body sculpting.  You need a step and barbells for that challenging section, as well as a medicine ball and hand weights.  It's also tough but the results are great.  At the end of that, is a tough ab workout.  This really does give you a full body workout and I highly recommend it to everyone whether you need to lose weight or you just want to mantain and keep your fitness up and muscles toned.  It's a lot of fun and well worth working your way to the level you need to complete it in one full go.
summary: Get ready to burn fat and calories ;-)
Title: N/A

reviewText: If I could only have one workout DVD it would be a cross between Boot Camp/Muscle Endurance or Jari Love Get Ripped 1000.  My whole body is sore the day after doing Boot Camp or Muscle Endurance.  Both workouts are for people that are serious about fitness.  I love this DVD much better than some of her newer work.  This DVD has it all!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Muscle endurance (5 stars)This workout is excellent. I've seen results in less than six sessions. Although, I always add additional weight and sometimes I will modify certain movements to hit my muscles a little differently.This workout also requires minimal equipment and space. (which is nice when you have a smaller room)You need hand weights (a barbell if you like, but not necessary) and a step up, but you don't need a ton of space to do the exercises.For any fitness enthusiast who is in a work out rut, this would be a great addition to your training.When I alternated this workout with my strength training at the gym, I noticed immediate results. I was able to lift heavier, longer, and did super sets, alternating chest and back the entire time.Boot Camp (4 stars)I didn't like this workout as much. Some of the cardio segments are too high impact for me. (I've had knee surgery, so I am always careful to maintain proper form)The exercises are performed so quickly that it's easy to loose form, so if you slow down to do it right, you won't be able to raise your heart rate as much.That's just my experience with it...The music is great though, very upbeat techno.
summary: Love Muscle Endurance, but the Boot Camp was OK
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 2 DVD set is one of my favorite Cathe workouts.  Boot Camp has a series of 1 minute cardio drills, followed by lower body and upper body sets.  The action is non-stop!  Cathe is her usual encouraging and motivating self and frequently says, "you can do anything for a minute."  Muscle Endurance is a series of exercises for your total body.These are more of muscle and cardio endurance workouts, rather than muscle building ones.BOOT CAMPWhy I loved Boot Camp:**My heart rate was elevated the entire time, even after finishing the cardio drills.  I felt great and very worked out at the end.**Cathe's encouragement, "you can do anything for a minute," really helped me push through this workout.**The premixes allow you to do just cardio plus upper body, or cardio plus lower body, plus a few other combinations.**The songs had a driving beat and many were recognizable.  I love working out to music like this.  I'm very disappointed with the music in Cathe's later workouts.MUSCLE ENDURANCEWhy I loved Muscle Endurance:**My heart rate was elevated the entire time, even this is not a cardio workout.**The premixes let you work just upper or just lower body.As an added bonus, there's a 70 minute workout that combines sections of both Boot Camp and Muscle Endurance.  It's like getting a third workout.I highly recommend this DVD set to anyone wanting to rev up their workouts.  You will be challenged and engaged!
summary: You can do anything for a minute
